page.title: 17Change in Lydden-Mrs.Bradley
page.content: Many changes have taken place during her lifetime and she has seen many amenities disappear. There used to be three shops in the village but only the Post Office/General Store now remains. The railway station was closed in April 1954. Mrs Bradley remembers that there were three bus companies operating in Lydden in the early 1920s.A Wesleyan Methodist Chapel was demolished in 1969 leaving two Churches in present day Lydden. In the 1920s water was laid on to Lydden village and in 1956 street lights were erected.In 1940 Lydden Primary school was built and Mrs Bradley recalled that when she was in school,children did not have to wear uniform. Mrs.Bradley felt that Lydden used to be a united village.There are many more houses now and she feels that there is no village atmosphere as many people work outside the area.
